data.event: Growing European exploration in the 17th century and the desire for the Europeans to establish a presence close to local Native occupants to control trade led to the founding of a French trading post known as Fort Frontenac in 1673.

event.title: was named the first capital of the Province of Canada on February 10, 1841

data.event: Kingston was named the first capital of the Province of Canada on February 10, 1841.

event.title: lived in the Kingston region as early as the Archaic Period (about 9,000–3,000 years ago

data.event: Archaeological evidence suggests that Native peoples lived in the Kingston region as early as the Archaic Period (about 9,000–3,000 years ago).

event.title: 1000–500 AD) early Iroquois occupation also exists

data.event: Evidence of Late Woodland Period (about 1000–500 AD) early Iroquois occupation also exists.
